subject: Re: [junit] Re: Are tests run concurrently
msgSnippet: ... Yes.  But the same problem remains: either the individual tests must be single-threaded, or they must handle their internal concurrency themselves. -- Jim
messageBody:
On Fri, 3 Oct 2003, Jeff Grigg wrote:

> > JUnit never runs tests concurrently. You can, however, build
> > multithreaded test case classes.
>
> See 'junit.extensions.ActiveTestSuite'. It will run all of your
> TestCases simultaneously, using threads.
>
> It's part of the standard JUnit distribution.

Yes. But the same problem remains: either the individual tests
must be single-threaded, or they must handle their internal concurrency
themselves.
